channel.title: Need help setting up my server+client
channel.description:
ok so i downloaded an open source client, and i just need to know how to get it online.
when i put in my IP address it doesnt work. if someone could please help me out on starting my server+client it would be awesome.
you can talk to me on MSN messenger, my username is tawkohs@hotmail.com
and also AIM, my username on AIM is Substantilicious.
thanks :)

item.title: Need help setting up my server+client

item.title: Need help setting up my server+client
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“bmxrider193, post:3, topic:260562”]i downloaded a server that someone else made, and i can edit it, its like open source or something.

i need to know how to port forward 43594 and how to get my client online and log in[/quote]

Oh, another one of… “you”… They don’t help with port forwarding here. Read the rules.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help setting up my server+client

item.title: Need help setting up my server+client
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

well

  1. compile
  2. open run.bat
  3. open your custom client (or use client.silabsoft.org)
  4. when you log in,
    Username: yournamehere
    Password: ********
    Server IP:
    ^either leave blank or put 127.0.0.1
    Port: yourporthere (43594)
    [br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 05, 2009, 05:51:47 pm[/size][hr]and to portforward go to your firewall settings, then go to exceptions.

click new> Port name: rsps
Port (may say some otherstuff here): 43594
and select TCP

then open start > run > type cmd > then on the pop-up type ipconfig > look at the defoult gateway…xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx << that number goes in your adress bar.

go to portforward.com and find your router for some more help.

Read full topic
